item.title: Fly-tipped gas canister., 22nd June
item.description:
Someone has fly-tipped some kind of gas canister behind our front garden wall. We do not own a vehicle so cannot take it to the local tip. And we cannot put it in our domestic waste bins because we do not know if it is empty.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Flaxton Road, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Green Man not visible, 22nd June
item.description:
The ‘Green Man’ is not visible at this busy pedestrian crossing because of the angle of the metal ‘sun slats.’ (The photo shows the Green man ‘on’ ). Makes the crossing (where cars travel v fast) dangerous.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Road, West Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped rubbish, 22nd June

item.title: Fly tipping, damage and severe littering, 22nd June
item.description:
There were contractors with (we assume) permission to gate off this corner of public space and use it to clear out a house. While they have removed the large rubbish, fly tipping and an extraordinary amount of litter still remains while they appear to have disappeared. This used to be a green, clean, area with wildflowers and a usable pathway- but this company have destroyed the whole area and left a significant amount of litter (including old insulation) which is unhygienic and a danger to children and animals

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Greenbay Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dangerous parking, 22nd June
item.description:
This vehicle is parked dangerously on the bend even though there are signs stating no parking. A child nearly got hit by a car today which the driver couldn’t see the child as his vision was blocked by this vehicle. Also there is a weight limit of 5 ton and this commercial vehicle well exceeds this

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Clayhill Crescent, Chinbrook, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Public toilets at Danson Play park need to be cleaned, 22nd June
item.description:
The toilets are too filthy for children especially, to use hygienically. The middle girls toilet was full of rubbish. The smell was unbearable. So disappointing as the park is otherwise lovely.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Danson Park, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet
